table.style: border: 0px; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;

tr.style: border: 1px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;
border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A request to supply a diet, formula feeding (enteral) or oral nutritional supplement to a patient/resident.

tr.td: A request for a diet, formula or nutritional supplement

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The person (patient) who needs the nutrition order for an oral diet, nutritional supplement and/or enteral or formula feeding.

tr.td: The person who requires the diet, formula or nutritional supplement

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The practitioner that holds legal responsibility for ordering the diet, nutritional supplement, or formula feedings.

tr.td: Who ordered the diet, formula or nutritional supplement

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Identifiers assigned to this order by the order sender or by the order receiver.

tr.td: Identifiers assigned to this order

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: An encounter that provides additional information about the healthcare context in which this request is made.

tr.td: The encounter associated with that this nutrition order

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The date and time that this nutrition order was requested.

tr.td: Date and time the nutrition order was requested

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The ability to list substances that may cause allergies or intolerances which should be included in the nutrition order.

tr.td: List of the patient's food and nutrition-related allergies and intolerances

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: This modifier is used to convey order-specific modifiers about the type of food that should be given. These can be derived from patient allergies, intolerances, or preferences such as Halal, Vegan or Kosher. This modifier applies to the entire nutrition order inclusive of the oral diet, nutritional supplements and enteral formula feedings.

tr.td:
Order-specific modifier about the type of food that should be given
PatientDiet ( Incomplete)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: This modifier is used to convey order-specific modifiers about the type of food that should NOT be given. These can be derived from patient allergies, intolerances, or preferences such as No Red Meat, No Soy or No Wheat or Gluten-Free. This modifier applies to the entire nutrition order inclusive of the oral diet, nutritional supplements and enteral formula feedings.

tr.td:
Order-specific modifier about the type of food that should not be given
ExcludeFoodModifier ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Different items that combine to make a complete description of the nutrition to be provided via oral diet, nutritional supplement and/or formula order.
This element has or is affected by some invariants

tr.td:
Set of nutrition items or components that comprise the nutrition order
Nutrition Order SHALL contain either Oral Diet , Supplement, or Enteral Formula class

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The frequency at which the diet, oral supplement or enteral formula should be given.

tr.td: Frequency to offer nutrition item

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0MSQAM/0kGANBnY4VdK5wIAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

tr.td: scheduledTiming

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Indicates whether the nutrition item is currently in effect for the patient.

tr.td: Indicates whether the nutrition item is currently in effect

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Class that defines the components of an oral diet order for the patient.
This element has or is affected by some invariants

tr.td: Oral diet components

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0MSQAM/0kGANBnY4VdK5wIAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Indicates the type of oral diet or diet restrictions that describe what can be consumed orally (i.e., take via the mouth).

tr.td:
Type of oral diet or diet restrictions that describe what can be consumed orally
OralDiet ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0MSQAM/0kGANBnY4VdK5wIAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Class that defines the details of any nutrient modifications required for the oral diet.

tr.td: Required nutrient modifications

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0KiQYM/0kGAM13Y30TkjPDAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Identifies the type of nutrient that is being modified such as carbohydrate or sodium.

tr.td:
Type of nutrient that is being modified
NutrientModifier ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0MSQAM/0kGANBnY4VdK5wIAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The quantity or range of the specified nutrient to supply.

tr.td: Quantity of the specified nutrient

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4/x0M/4MxUYDhP8kAAM2HY30B25D0AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A measured amount (or an amount that can potentially be measured). Note that measured amounts include amounts that are not precisely quantified, including amounts involving arbitrary units and floating currencies.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0MSQAM/0kGANBnY4VdK5wIAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A set of ordered Quantities defined by a low and high limit.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0MSQAM/0kGANBnY4VdK5wIAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Class that describes any texture modifications required for the patient to safely consume various types of solid foods.

tr.td: Required texture modifications

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0KiQYM/0kGAM13Y30TkjPDAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Identifies any texture modifications (for solid foods) that should be made, e.g. easy to chew, chopped, ground, and pureed.

tr.td:
Code to indicate how to alter the texture of the foods, e.g., pureed
TextureModifier ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0MSQAM/0kGANBnY4VdK5wIAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Indicates what specific type of food (e.g., meats) the texture modification applies to or may apply to all foods in the diet.

tr.td:
Concepts that are used to identify an entity that is ingested for nutritional purposes
FoodType ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0MSQAM/0kGANBnY4VdK5wIAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Identifies the required consistency (e.g., honey-thick, nectar-thick, thin, thickened.) of liquids or fluids served to the patient.

tr.td:
The required consistency of fluids and liquids provided to the patient
FluidConsistencyType ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Additional instructions or information pertaining to the oral diet.

tr.td: Instructions or additional information about the oral diet

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Class that defines the components of a supplement order for the patient.
This element has or is affected by some invariants

tr.td: Supplement components

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0MSQAM/0kGANBnY4VdK5wIAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Indicates the type of nutritional supplement product required such as high protein or pediatric clear liquid supplement.

tr.td:
Type of supplement product requested
SupplementType ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0MSQAM/0kGANBnY4VdK5wIAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The amount of the nutritional supplement product to provide to the patient.

tr.td: Amount of the nutritional supplement

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The product or brand name of the nutritional supplement product to be provided to the patient.

tr.td: Product or brand name of the nutritional supplement

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Class that defines the components of an enteral formula order for the patient.
This element has or is affected by some invariants

tr.td: Enteral formula components

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Free text formula administration or feeding instructions for cases where the instructions are too complex to code.

tr.td: Formula feeding instructions expressed as text

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Indicates the type of enteral or infant formula requested such as an adult standard formula with fiber or a soy-based infant formula.

tr.td:
Type of enteral or infant formula
EnteralFormulaType ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The product or brand name of the enteral or infant formula product to be provided to the patient.

tr.td: Product or brand name of the enteral or infant formula

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Indicates the type of modular component such as protein, carbohydrate, fat or fiber to be provided in addition to or mixed with the base formula.

tr.td:
Type of modular component to add to the feeding
EnteralFormulaAdditiveType ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The product or brand name of the type of modular component to be added to the formula.

tr.td: Product or brand name of the modular additive

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The amount of energy (Calories) that the formula should provide per specified volume, typically per mL or fluid oz. For example, an infant may require a formula the provides 24 Calories per fluid ounce or an adult may require an enteral formula that provides 1.5 Calorie/mL.

tr.td: Amount of energy per specified volume that is required

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A coded concept specifying the route or physiological path of administration into the patient 's gastrointestinal tract for purposes of providing the formula feeding, e.g., nasogastric tube.

tr.td:
How the formula should enter the patient's gastrointestinal tract
EnteralRouteOfAdministration ( Incomplete)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The volume of formula to provide to the patient per the specified administration schedule.

tr.td: The volume of formula to provide

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Identifies the speed with which the formula is introduced into the subject via a feeding pump, e.g., 60 mL per hour, according to the specified schedule.

tr.td: Speed with which the formula is provided per period of time

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The change in the administration rate over a given time, e.g. increase by 10 mL/hour every 4 hours.

tr.td: Change in the rate of administration over a given time

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The maximum total quantity of formula that may be administered to a subject over the period of time, e.g., 1440 mL over 24 hours.

tr.td: Upper limit on formula volume per unit of time

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAD0lEQVR42mP4TzJgIF0LANmXY523xFiMAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The workflow status of the nutrition order request, e.g., Active, Inactive, Pending, Held, Canceled, Suspended.

tr.td:
requested | active | inactive | held | cancelled
NutritionOrderStatus ( Required)

short.value: A request for a diet, formula or nutritional supplement

formal.value: A request to supply a diet, formula feeding (enteral) or oral nutritional supplement to a patient/resident.

comments.value: Referenced by an Order Request (workflow).

short.value: Logical id of this artefact

formal.value: The logical id of the resource, as used in the url for the resoure. Once assigned, this value never changes.

comments.value: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation. Bundles always have an id, though it is usually a generated UUID.

short.value: Metadata about the resource

formal.value: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

formal.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

short.value: Additional Content defined by implementations

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

short.value: Extensions that cannot be ignored

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

short.value: Version specific identifier

formal.value: The version specific identifier, as it appears in the version portion of the url. This values changes when the resource is created, updated, or deleted.

comments.value: The server assigns this value, and ignores what the client specifies, except in the case that the server is imposing version integrity on updates/deletes.

short.value: When the resource version last changed

formal.value: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.

comments.value: This value is always populated except when the resource is first being created. The server / resource manager sets this value; what a client provides is irrelevant.

short.value: Profiles this resource claims to conform to

formal.value: A list of profiles that this resource claims to conform to. The URL is a reference to Profile.url.

comments.value: It is up to the server and/or other infrastruture of policy to determine whether/how these claims are verified and/or updated over tiem.

short.value: Security Labels applied to this resource

formal.value: Security labels applied to this resource. These tags connect specific resources to the overall security policy and infrastructure.

comments.value: The security labels can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource.

short.value: Tags applied

formal.value: Tags applied to this resource. Tags are intended to to be used to identify and relate resources to process and workflow, and applications are not required to consider the tags when interpreting the meaning of a resource.

comments.value: The tags can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource.

short.value: A set of rules under which this content was created

formal.value: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.

comments.value: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.

short.value: Language of the resource content

formal.value: The base language in which the resource is written.

comments.value:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource
Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

short.value: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

formal.value: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

comments.value: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

short.value: Contained, inline Resources

formal.value: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

comments.value: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

short.value: Additional Content defined by implementations

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

short.value: Extensions that cannot be ignored

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

short.value: The person who requires the diet, formula or nutritional supplement

formal.value: The person (patient) who needs the nutrition order for an oral diet, nutritional supplement and/or enteral or formula feeding.

short.value: Who ordered the diet, formula or nutritional supplement

formal.value: The practitioner that holds legal responsibility for ordering the diet, nutritional supplement, or formula feedings.

short.value: Identifiers assigned to this order

formal.value: Identifiers assigned to this order by the order sender or by the order receiver.

short.value: The encounter associated with that this nutrition order

formal.value: An encounter that provides additional information about the healthcare context in which this request is made.

short.value: Date and time the nutrition order was requested

formal.value: The date and time that this nutrition order was requested.

short.value: List of the patient's food and nutrition-related allergies and intolerances

formal.value: The ability to list substances that may cause allergies or intolerances which should be included in the nutrition order.

short.value: Order-specific modifier about the type of food that should be given

formal.value: This modifier is used to convey order-specific modifiers about the type of food that should be given. These can be derived from patient allergies, intolerances, or preferences such as Halal, Vegan or Kosher. This modifier applies to the entire nutrition order inclusive of the oral diet, nutritional supplements and enteral formula feedings.

description.value: Medical, cultural or ethical food preferences to help with catering requirements

short.value: Order-specific modifier about the type of food that should not be given

formal.value: This modifier is used to convey order-specific modifiers about the type of food that should NOT be given. These can be derived from patient allergies, intolerances, or preferences such as No Red Meat, No Soy or No Wheat or Gluten-Free. This modifier applies to the entire nutrition order inclusive of the oral diet, nutritional supplements and enteral formula feedings.

short.value: Set of nutrition items or components that comprise the nutrition order

formal.value: Different items that combine to make a complete description of the nutrition to be provided via oral diet, nutritional supplement and/or formula order.

human.value: Nutrition Order SHALL contain either Oral Diet , Supplement, or Enteral Formula class

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

formal.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

short.value: Frequency to offer nutrition item

formal.value: The frequency at which the diet, oral supplement or enteral formula should be given.

short.value: Indicates whether the nutrition item is currently in effect

formal.value: Indicates whether the nutrition item is currently in effect for the patient.

short.value: Oral diet components

formal.value: Class that defines the components of an oral diet order for the patient.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

formal.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

short.value: Additional Content defined by implementations

short.value: Type of oral diet or diet restrictions that describe what can be consumed orally

formal.value: Indicates the type of oral diet or diet restrictions that describe what can be consumed orally (i.e., take via the mouth).

short.value: Required nutrient modifications

formal.value: Class that defines the details of any nutrient modifications required for the oral diet.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

formal.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. short.value: Type of nutrient that is being modified

formal.value: Identifies the type of nutrient that is being modified such as carbohydrate or sodium.

short.value: Quantity of the specified nutrient

formal.value: The quantity or range of the specified nutrient to supply.

short.value: Required texture modifications

formal.value: Class that describes any texture modifications required for the patient to safely consume various types of solid foods.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

formal.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

short.value: Additional Content defined by implementations

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. short.value: Code to indicate how to alter the texture of the foods, e.g., pureed

formal.value: Identifies any texture modifications (for solid foods) that should be made, e.g. easy to chew, chopped, ground, and pureed.

comments.value: Coupled with the foodType (Meat).

short.value: Concepts that are used to identify an entity that is ingested for nutritional purposes

formal.value: Indicates what specific type of food (e.g., meats) the texture modification applies to or may apply to all foods in the diet.

comments.value: Coupled with the textureModifier; could be (All Foods).

short.value: The required consistency of fluids and liquids provided to the patient

formal.value: Identifies the required consistency (e.g., honey-thick, nectar-thick, thin, thickened.) of liquids or fluids served to the patient.

short.value: Instructions or additional information about the oral diet

formal.value: Additional instructions or information pertaining to the oral diet.

short.value: Supplement components

formal.value: Class that defines the components of a supplement order for the patient.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

formal.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

short.value: Type of supplement product requested

formal.value: Indicates the type of nutritional supplement product required such as high protein or pediatric clear liquid supplement.

short.value: Amount of the nutritional supplement

formal.value: The amount of the nutritional supplement product to provide to the patient.

short.value: Product or brand name of the nutritional supplement

formal.value: The product or brand name of the nutritional supplement product to be provided to the patient.

short.value: Enteral formula components

formal.value: Class that defines the components of an enteral formula order for the patient.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

formal.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

short.value: Formula feeding instructions expressed as text

formal.value: Free text formula administration or feeding instructions for cases where the instructions are too complex to code.

short.value: Type of enteral or infant formula

formal.value: Indicates the type of enteral or infant formula requested such as an adult standard formula with fiber or a soy-based infant formula.

short.value: Product or brand name of the enteral or infant formula

formal.value: The product or brand name of the enteral or infant formula product to be provided to the patient.

short.value: Type of modular component to add to the feeding

formal.value: Indicates the type of modular component such as protein, carbohydrate, fat or fiber to be provided in addition to or mixed with the base formula.

short.value: Product or brand name of the modular additive

formal.value: The product or brand name of the type of modular component to be added to the formula.

short.value: Amount of energy per specified volume that is required

formal.value: The amount of energy (Calories) that the formula should provide per specified volume, typically per mL or fluid oz. For example, an infant may require a formula the provides 24 Calories per fluid ounce or an adult may require an enteral formula that provides 1.5 Calorie/mL.

short.value: How the formula should enter the patient's gastrointestinal tract

formal.value: A coded concept specifying the route or physiological path of administration into the patient 's gastrointestinal tract for purposes of providing the formula feeding, e.g., nasogastric tube.

description.value: This value set contains concepts to support administration of formula feeding via oral or enteral feeding tubes

short.value: The volume of formula to provide

formal.value: The volume of formula to provide to the patient per the specified administration schedule.

short.value: Speed with which the formula is provided per period of time

formal.value: Identifies the speed with which the formula is introduced into the subject via a feeding pump, e.g., 60 mL per hour, according to the specified schedule.

short.value: Change in the rate of administration over a given time

formal.value: The change in the administration rate over a given time, e.g. increase by 10 mL/hour every 4 hours.

short.value: Upper limit on formula volume per unit of time

formal.value: The maximum total quantity of formula that may be administered to a subject over the period of time, e.g., 1440 mL over 24 hours.

short.value: requested | active | inactive | held | cancelled

formal.value: The workflow status of the nutrition order request, e.g., Active, Inactive, Pending, Held, Canceled, Suspended.

comments.value: Typically the system placing the order sets the status to requested. There after, the order is maintained by the receiver that updates the status as the request is handled.

formal.value: Indicates the type of nutritional supplement product required such as high protein or pediatric clear liquid supplement.
